output:
{"hookSpecificOutput":{"hookEventName":"SessionStart","additionalContext":"# MODE ENTRY IS MANDATORY

**CRITICAL**: Before doing ANY work, you MUST enter a mode.

## Available Modes

freeform, implementation, planning, research, task

## Quick Reference

| Mode | Description | Issue Required? |
|------|-------------|-----------------|
| `freeform` | Quick questions and discussion (no phases) | No |
| `implementation` | Execute approved specs - phases defined in spec YAML frontmatter | **Yes** |
| `planning` | Research â†’ spec â†’ review â†’ approved | **Yes** |
| `research` | Explore â†’ synthesize findings | No |
| `task` | Combined planning + implementation for small tasks and chores | No |

## Classify User Intent

| User Says | Intent | Mode |
|-----------|--------|------|
| "add X to CLI", "quick change", "small refactor" | SMALL TASK | `task` |
| "implement issue #123", "build feature from spec" | SPEC WORK | `implementation` |
| "bug: ...", "fix #456", "broken ..." | BUG FIX | `bugfix` |
| "plan ...", "design ...", "spec ..." | PLANNING | `planning` |
| "how does ...", "what is ...", "explain ..." | QUESTION | `freeform` |
| "research ...", "comprehensive exploration" | RESEARCH | `research` |
| "investigate ...", "why is ...", "debug ..." | DEBUG | `debug` |

## Commands

```bash
kata enter <mode>                       # Enter a mode
kata enter implementation --issue=123  # Issue-backed from spec
kata link <issue-num>                   # Link session to issue mid-session
kata status                             # Check current mode and phase
kata can-exit                           # Check stop conditions
```

**NEVER skip mode entry.** Work without a mode loses tracking, context, and guidance."}}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ“‹ FULL MODE INSTRUCTIONS: research
   Workflow: RE-6e1a-0221
   Current Phase: p0
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

---
id: research
name: Research Mode
description: Deep exploration with documented findings and agent-parallel search
mode: research

phases:
  - id: p0
    name: Initial Clarification
    task_config:
      title: "P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why"
      labels: [phase, phase-0, clarify]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: clarify-intent
        title: "Clarify research intent"
        instruction: |
          Use AskUserQuestion IMMEDIATELY after mode activation to understand:
          - What topic/area they want to explore
          - Why they need this research (context)
          - What they'll do with the findings

          AskUserQuestion(questions=[
            {
              question: "What would you like to research or explore?",
              header: "Topic",
              options: [
                {label: "Codebase patterns", description: "Find how something is implemented"},
                {label: "External best practices", description: "Research industry approaches"},
                {label: "Both codebase + external", description: "Comprehensive exploration"},
                {label: "Discussion only", description: "Brainstorm or clarify ideas"}
              ],
              multiSelect: false
            },
            {
              question: "What's the context for this research?",
              header: "Context",
              options: [
                {label: "Planning a feature", description: "Research before writing a spec"},
                {label: "Debugging", description: "Understanding existing behavior"},
                {label: "Decision making", description: "Evaluating architectural options"},
                {label: "Learning", description: "General understanding"}
              ],
              multiSelect: false
            }
          ])

          Based on answers, determine which phases to include/skip.
          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p1
    name: Scope Definition
    task_config:
      title: "P1: Scope - define questions and success criteria"
      labels: [phase, phase-1, scope]
      depends_on: [p0]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: define-questions
        title: "Define specific research questions"
        instruction: |
          Write down the specific questions this research needs to answer:

          1. Primary question: {what must be answered}
          2. Secondary questions: {nice to have}
          3. Success criteria: {what does a complete answer look like}

          Also: check GitHub issues for related context:
          ```bash
          gh issue list --search "{topic}" --limit 5
          ```

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

      - id: set-boundaries
        title: "Set research boundaries"
        instruction: |
          Define explicit boundaries to prevent scope creep:

          **IN scope:**
          - {what to explore}

          **OUT of scope:**
          - {what to skip even if interesting}

          **Time limit:** Set a rough budget (e.g. "30 min codebase, 15 min external").
          Research expands indefinitely without boundaries.

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p2
    name: Codebase Research
    optional: true
    task_config:
      title: "P2: Codebase - parallel agent exploration (optional)"
      labels: [phase, phase-2, codebase, optional]
      depends_on: [p1]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: spawn-explore-parallel
        title: "Spawn parallel Explore agents"
        instruction: |
          Run multiple agents in parallel for fast codebase coverage:

          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
            Find implementations of {topic} in the codebase.
            Search with Glob and Grep for relevant files.
            Read the most relevant files IN FULL.
            Document: file paths, function names, key patterns.
            Be thorough â€” don't just skim.
          ", run_in_background=true)

          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
            Search .claude/rules/ and docs/ for patterns related to {topic}.
            List: constraints, best practices, architectural decisions.
            Read relevant rule files IN FULL.
          ", run_in_background=true)

          # Store task IDs for aggregation step below

      - id: aggregate-codebase-findings
        title: "Aggregate codebase findings"
        instruction: |
          Wait for all agents:
          TaskOutput(task_id=..., block=true)  # each agent

          Compile into structured findings:
          ## Codebase Findings
          - Pattern 1: {description} (source: file:line)
          - Pattern 2: {description} (source: file:line)
          - Existing constraint: {rule or decision}

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p3
    name: External Research
    optional: true
    task_config:
      title: "P3: External - documentation and best practices (optional)"
      labels: [phase, phase-3, external, optional]
      depends_on: [p2]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: web-research
        title: "Web research and documentation review"
        instruction: |
          Search for external context:
          WebSearch(query="{topic} best practices {year}")
          WebSearch(query="{topic} vs {alternative} comparison")

          Fetch relevant documentation:
          WebFetch(url="{doc-url}", prompt="Extract key patterns and recommendations")

          Document findings with sources (URLs).
          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p4
    name: Synthesis
    task_config:
      title: "P4: Synthesize - compile findings, identify recommendations"
      labels: [phase, phase-4, synthesize]
      depends_on: [p3]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: synthesize-findings
        title: "Synthesize all findings"
        instruction: |
          Create structured summary:

          ## Research Summary: {topic}

          ### Questions Answered
          - Q: {question}
            A: {answer} (source: file:line or URL)

          ### Key Findings
          - {finding} (source)
          - {finding} (source)

          ### Recommendations
          | Option | Pros | Cons | Fit |
          |--------|------|------|-----|
          | A      | ...  | ...  | High|
          | B      | ...  | ...  | Med |

          ### Open Questions
          - {what's still unclear}

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

      - id: create-research-doc
        title: "Write research findings document"
        instruction: |
          Read `research_path` from `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml` (default: `planning/research`).
          Create persistent findings doc at:
          `{research_path}/{YYYY-MM-DD}-{slug}.md`

          Structure:
          ```markdown
          ---
          date: {YYYY-MM-DD}
          topic: {topic}
          status: complete
          github_issue: {N or null}
          ---

          # Research: {topic}

          ## Context
          Why this research was done.

          ## Questions Explored
          - {question 1}

          ## Findings
          ### Codebase
          - {finding} (file:line)

          ### External
          - {finding} (URL)

          ## Recommendations
          {ranked options}

          ## Open Questions
          - {unclear things}

          ## Next Steps
          {none / create spec / more research}
          ```

          Then commit:
          ```bash
          git add {research_path}/
          git commit -m "docs(research): {topic}"
          git push
          ```

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p5
    name: Present
    task_config:
      title: "P5: Present - share findings, determine next steps"
      labels: [phase, phase-5, present]
      depends_on: [p4]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: present-and-decide
        title: "Present findings and decide next step"
        instruction: |
          Present the research summary to the user.

          Then ask:
          AskUserQuestion(questions=[{
            question: "Research complete. What next?",
            header: "Next Step",
            options: [
              {label: "Plan the feature", description: "Switch to planning mode to write a spec"},
              {label: "More research needed", description: "Continue exploring specific questions"},
              {label: "Done", description: "Research complete, no immediate action"}
            ],
            multiSelect: false
          }])

          Follow through on their choice.
          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - changes_pushed

workflow_id_format: "RS-{session_last_4}-{MMDD}"
---

# Research Mode

Deep exploration with parallel agent search and documented findings.

## Phase Flow

```
P0: Clarify (required)     â†’ understand what to research
P1: Scope (required)       â†’ define questions + success criteria
P2: Codebase (optional)    â†’ parallel Explore agents
P3: External (optional)    â†’ web search + documentation
P4: Synthesize (required)  â†’ compile findings + write research doc
P5: Present (required)     â†’ share results + decide next step
```

## Output

- Research doc: `{research_path}/{date}-{slug}.md` (configurable in wm.yaml)
- Structured findings with sources
- Ranked recommendations
- Next steps (none, planning, more research)

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p2
    name: Codebase Research
    optional: true
    task_config:
      title: "P2: Codebase - parallel agent exploration (optional)"
      labels: [phase, phase-2, codebase, optional]
      depends_on: [p1]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: spawn-explore-parallel
        title: "Spawn parallel Explore agents"
        instruction: |
          Run multiple agents in parallel for fast codebase coverage:

          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
            Find implementations of {topic} in the codebase.
            Search with Glob and Grep for relevant files.
            Read the most relevant files IN FULL.
            Document: file paths, function names, key patterns.
            Be thorough â€” don't just skim.
          ", run_in_background=true)

          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
            Search .claude/rules/ and docs/ for patterns related to {topic}.
            List: constraints, best practices, architectural decisions.
            Read relevant rule files IN FULL.
          ", run_in_background=true)

          # Store task IDs for aggregation step below

      - id: aggregate-codebase-findings
        title: "Aggregate codebase findings"
        instruction: |
          Wait for all agents:
          TaskOutput(task_id=..., block=true)  # each agent

          Compile into structured findings:
          ## Codebase Findings
          - Pattern 1: {description} (source: file:line)
          - Pattern 2: {description} (source: file:line)
          - Existing constraint: {rule or decision}

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p3
    name: External Research
    optional: true
    task_config:
      title: "P3: External - documentation and best practices (optional)"
      labels: [phase, phase-3, external, optional]
      depends_on: [p2]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: web-research
        title: "Web research and documentation review"
        instruction: |
          Search for external context:
          WebSearch(query="{topic} best practices {year}")
          WebSearch(query="{topic} vs {alternative} comparison")

          Fetch relevant documentation:
          WebFetch(url="{doc-url}", prompt="Extract key patterns and recommendations")

          Document findings with sources (URLs).
          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p4
    name: Synthesis
    task_config:
      title: "P4: Synthesize - compile findings, identify recommendations"
      labels: [phase, phase-4, synthesize]
      depends_on: [p3]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: synthesize-findings
        title: "Synthesize all findings"
        instruction: |
          Create structured summary:

          ## Research Summary: {topic}

          ### Questions Answered
          - Q: {question}
            A: {answer} (source: file:line or URL)

          ### Key Findings
          - {finding} (source)
          - {finding} (source)

          ### Recommendations
          | Option | Pros | Cons | Fit |
          |--------|------|------|-----|
          | A      | ...  | ...  | High|
          | B      | ...  | ...  | Med |

          ### Open Questions
          - {what's still unclear}

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

      - id: create-research-doc
        title: "Write research findings document"
        instruction: |
          Read `research_path` from `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml` (default: `planning/research`).
          Create persistent findings doc at:
          `{research_path}/{YYYY-MM-DD}-{slug}.md`

          Structure:
          ```markdown
          ---
          date: {YYYY-MM-DD}
          topic: {topic}
          status: complete
          github_issue: {N or null}
          ---

          # Research: {topic}

          ## Context
          Why this research was done.

          ## Questions Explored
          - {question 1}

          ## Findings
          ### Codebase
          - {finding} (file:line)

          ### External
          - {finding} (URL)

          ## Recommendations
          {ranked options}

          ## Open Questions
          - {unclear things}

          ## Next Steps
          {none / create spec / more research}
          ```

          Then commit:
          ```bash
          git add {research_path}/
          git commit -m "docs(research): {topic}"
          git push
          ```

          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

  - id: p5
    name: Present
    task_config:
      title: "P5: Present - share findings, determine next steps"
      labels: [phase, phase-5, present]
      depends_on: [p4]
    gate: false
    steps:
      - id: present-and-decide
        title: "Present findings and decide next step"
        instruction: |
          Present the research summary to the user.

          Then ask:
          AskUserQuestion(questions=[{
            question: "Research complete. What next?",
            header: "Next Step",
            options: [
              {label: "Plan the feature", description: "Switch to planning mode to write a spec"},
              {label: "More research needed", description: "Continue exploring specific questions"},
              {label: "Done", description: "Research complete, no immediate action"}
            ],
            multiSelect: false
          }])

          Follow through on their choice.
          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

P3: External (optional)    â†’ web search + documentation
P4: Synthesize (required)  â†’ compile findings + write research doc
P5: Present (required)     â†’ share results + decide next step
```

## Output

- Structured findings with sources
- Ranked recommendations
- Next steps (none, planning, more research)

- **OUT of scope:** Deployment, styling, state management beyond routing, testing strategies
- **Budget:** Thorough codebase exploration + targeted external docs

## TanStack Start App Routing System Analysis

Based on my thorough exploration of `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/`, here's the complete routing system breakdown:

### Project Structure

**Root Level Files:**
- `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/package.json` - Dependencies and scripts
- `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/vite.config.ts` - Vite build configuration
- `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/tsconfig.json` - TypeScript configuration
- `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/CLAUDE.md` - Project documentation

**Source Directory Structure:**
```
src/
â”œâ”€â”€ router.tsx          # Router configuration and setup
â”œâ”€â”€ routes/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __root.tsx      # Root layout component
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ index.tsx       # Home page route
â””â”€â”€ styles.css          # Global styles (Tailwind CSS)
```

### Router Configuration

**File:** `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/src/router.tsx`

This file creates the router instance using TanStack Router v1.132.0:
- Imports `createRouter` from `@tanstack/react-router`
- Imports the auto-generated `routeTree` from `./routeTree.gen` (this file is auto-generated by the build system)
- Configures settings:
  - `scrollRestoration: true` - Restores scroll position on navigation
  - `defaultPreload: 'intent'` - Preloads routes on user intent (hover/focus)
  - `defaultPreloadStaleTime: 0` - Routes are preloaded immediately
- Exports `getRouter()` function that returns the configured router instance
- Includes TypeScript module augmentation for router type registration

**Note:** The `routeTree.gen.ts` file is auto-generated by the `@tanstack/router-plugin` during the Vite build process (configured in vite.config.ts). The `.vscode/settings.json` file explicitly marks this as read-only and excludes it from search/watching.

### Root Route

**File:** `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/src/routes/__root.tsx`

This is the root layout that wraps all routes:
- Uses `createRootRoute()` from `@tanstack/react-router`
- **Component Export:** `Route = createRootRoute({...})`
- **Head Configuration:** Sets HTML metadata including:
  - UTF-8 charset
  - Viewport settings for responsive design
  - Page title: "TanStack Start Starter"
  - Links to global CSS stylesheet
- **Shell Component:** `RootDocument` - provides the HTML structure with:
  - `<html lang="en">` wrapper
  - `<HeadContent />` component that renders head metadata
  - `{children}` placeholder for nested routes
  - `<TanStackDevtools>` integration with React DevTools
  - `<TanStackRouterDevtoolsPanel>` for router debugging
  - `<Scripts />` for hydration scripts

### Index Route (Home Page)

**File:** `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/src/routes/index.tsx`

This is the root path `/`:
- Uses `createFileRoute('/')` from `@tanstack/react-router`
- **Component Export:** `Route = createFileRoute('/')({ component: App })`
- **Component:** `App()` function that renders:
  - Full-screen dark gradient background (slate-900/800 colors)
  - Hero section with:
    - TanStack logo and "TANSTACK START" heading with gradient text
    - Tagline: "The framework for next generation AI applications"
    - Description of the framework capabilities
    - "Documentation" link to https://tanstack.com/start
    - Instructions pointing to `/src/routes/index.tsx` for editing
  - Feature grid (6 features) with icons from `lucide-react`:
    1. **Powerful Server Functions** - Zap icon
    2. **Flexible Server Side Rendering** - Server icon
    3. **API Routes** - Route icon
    4. **Strongly Typed Everything** - Shield icon
    5. **Full Streaming Support** - Waves icon
    6. **Next Generation Ready** - Sparkles icon

### Build and Route Generation

**Vite Configuration:** `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/vite.config.ts`

The build pipeline includes:
- `devtools()` - Tanstack DevTools plugin
- `tsconfigPaths()` - Path alias resolution
- `tailwindcss()` - Tailwind CSS support
- `tanstackStart()` - **TanStack Start plugin** (auto-generates `routeTree.gen.ts`)
- `viteReact()` - React support

**How File-Based Routing Works:**
1. The `@tanstack/router-plugin` scans the `src/routes/` directory
2. Routes are defined by file naming conventions:
   - `__root.tsx` = Root layout
   - `index.tsx` = Route at that directory level
   - Other patterns like `[id].tsx` would create dynamic segments
3. The plugin auto-generates `src/routeTree.gen.ts` containing the complete route tree structure
4. This route tree is imported in `router.tsx` and passed to `createTanStackRouter()`

### Key Dependencies

- `@tanstack/react-router` (v1.132.0) - Core routing
- `@tanstack/react-start` (v1.132.0) - Framework utilities
- `@tanstack/router-plugin` (v1.132.0) - File-based routing code generation
- `@tanstack/react-router-devtools` (v1.132.0) - Router debugging tools
- `@tanstack/react-devtools` (v0.7.0) - React DevTools integration
- `lucide-react` (v0.545.0) - SVG icons for UI features
- `tailwindcss` (v4.1.18) - Utility-first CSS
- `react` (v19.2.0) & `react-dom` (v19.2.0) - React framework

### Route Nesting Hierarchy

```
Root (__root.tsx)
â””â”€â”€ / (index.tsx) - Home page with features showcase
```

Currently, this is a minimal single-page app with only the root and home route. Additional routes would be added by creating new files in `src/routes/`:
- `about.tsx` â†’ `/about` route
- `contact.tsx` â†’ `/contact` route
- `[id].tsx` â†’ `/[dynamic-id]` route with param
- `nested/page.tsx` â†’ `/nested/page` route

### File Paths Summary

| File | Purpose | Route Mapped To |
|------|---------|-----------------|
| `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/src/routes/__root.tsx` | Root layout wrapper | N/A (applies to all routes) |
| `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/src/routes/index.tsx` | Home page component | `/` |
| `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/src/router.tsx` | Router instance factory | N/A (configuration only) |
| `/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start/vite.config.ts` | Build config with router plugin | N/A (generates routeTree.gen.ts) |
</output>

{"parentUuid":"5662bcda-7aea-4835-a4ec-e3498581ece7","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01T84jJdYGddS3dh6EWWevAV","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’# CLAUDE.md\n     2â†’\n     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.\n     4â†’\n     5â†’## Commands\n     6â†’\n     7â†’```bash\n     8â†’npm run build        # Compile TypeScript â†’ dist/ (required before running tests)\n     9â†’npm run dev          # Watch mode build\n    10â†’npm run typecheck    # Type-check without emitting\n    11â†’npm test             # Run tests (requires a prior build)\n    12â†’```\n    13â†’\n    14â†’To run tests after code changes: `npm run build && npm test`.\n    15â†’\n    16â†’Test files live alongside source with `.test.ts` suffixes (e.g. `src/commands/can-exit.test.ts`). Node's built-in test runner (`node --test`) executes them from `dist/testing/index.js`.\n    17â†’\n    18â†’The `kata` shell script at the repo root is the CLI entry point. It runs `dist/index.js` via Node when built, or falls back to Bun running `src/index.ts` directly for no-build development.\n    19â†’\n    20â†’## Architecture\n    21â†’\n    22â†’**kata-wm** is a TypeScript CLI published as an npm package (`kata-wm`). It wraps Claude Code projects with structured session modes, phase task enforcement, and stop hooks.\n    23â†’\n    24â†’### Source layout (`src/`)\n    25â†’\n    26â†’| Directory | Purpose |\n    27â†’|-----------|---------|\n    28â†’| `index.ts` | CLI dispatcher â€” maps `kata <command>` to handler functions; also re-exports the programmatic API |\n    29â†’| `commands/` | One file per CLI command (`enter.ts`, `exit.ts`, `hook.ts`, `setup.ts`, etc.) |\n    30â†’| `commands/enter/` | Sub-modules for the `enter` command: `task-factory.ts` (native task creation), `guidance.ts`, `template.ts`, `spec.ts` |\n    31â†’| `session/lookup.ts` | Project root discovery, session ID resolution, template path resolution |\n    32â†’| `state/` | Zod schema (`schema.ts`), reader/writer for `SessionState` JSON |\n    33â†’| `config/` | `wm-config.ts` loads `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml`; `cache.ts` loads and merges `modes.yaml` |\n    34â†’| `validation/` | Phase/template validation |\n    35â†’| `yaml/` | YAML frontmatter parser for template files |\n    36â†’| `utils/` | Workflow ID generation, session cleanup, timestamps |\n    37â†’| `testing/` | Test utilities exported as `kata-wm/testing` â€” mock sessions, hook runners, assertions, pre-built scenarios |\n    38â†’\n    39â†’### Build outputs\n    40â†’\n    41â†’tsup produces ESM-only output with two entry points:\n    42â†’- `dist/index.js` â€” main CLI and programmatic API\n    43â†’- `dist/testing/index.js` â€” test utilities (also used by `node --test` as the test runner)\n    44â†’\n    45â†’### Runtime data layout\n    46â†’\n    47â†’| Path | Contents |\n    48â†’|------|---------|\n    49â†’| `.claude/sessions/{sessionId}/state.json` | Per-session `SessionState` (mode, phase, workflow ID, history) |\n    50â†’| `~/.claude/tasks/{sessionId}/` | Native task files read by `can-exit` and `hook stop-conditions` |\n    51â†’| `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml` | Project config (`WmConfig`) |\n    52â†’| `.claude/workflows/modes.yaml` | Project-level mode overrides (merged over `modes.yaml` at package root) |\n    53â†’| `.claude/workflows/templates/` | Mode templates â€” `onboard.md` seeded by `kata setup`; full set seeded by `kata batteries` |\n    54â†’| `planning/spec-templates/` | Spec document stubs â€” feature, bug, epic (copied from `batteries/spec-templates/` during `kata batteries`) |\n    55â†’\n    56â†’### Hook architecture\n    57â†’\n    58â†’Hooks are registered in `.claude/settings.json` and call `kata hook <name>`. Each hook reads Claude Code's stdin JSON, extracts `session_id`, and outputs a JSON decision. The session ID from hook stdin **must** be forwarded as `--session=ID` to any subcommand â€” there is no automatic session detection at runtime.\n    59â†’\n    60â†’| Hook event | Command | Role |\n    61â†’|------------|---------|------|\n    62â†’| `SessionStart` | `kata hook session-start` | Init session registry, inject mode context |\n    63â†’| `UserPromptSubmit` | `kata hook user-prompt` | Detect mode intent, suggest entering a mode |\n    64â†’| `Stop` | `kata hook stop-conditions` | Block exit while native tasks are incomplete |\n    65â†’| `PreToolUse` (optional) | `kata hook mode-gate` / `task-deps` / `task-evidence` | Strict-mode enforcement |\n    66â†’\n    67â†’### Mode and template system\n    68â†’\n    69â†’Built-in modes are defined in `modes.yaml` (package root). Each mode references a template filename with YAML frontmatter defining phases, task titles, and dependency chains.\n    70â†’\n    71â†’**Template sources:**\n    72â†’- `templates/` â€” system templates only: `onboard.md` and `SESSION-TEMPLATE.template.md`\n    73â†’- `batteries/templates/` â€” canonical mode templates (implementation, planning, task, bugfix, etc.)\n    74â†’\n    75â†’After setup, the project owns copies under `.claude/workflows/templates/`. The package files are seeds only, not used at runtime. To update project templates with newer versions, run `kata batteries --update`.\n    76â†’\n    77â†’Project modes in `.claude/workflows/modes.yaml` are merged over the built-in set with project definitions taking precedence.\n    78â†’\n    79â†’### Key dependencies\n    80â†’\n    81â†’- **zod** â€” schema validation for `SessionState`, `ModeConfig`, and config files\n    82â†’- **js-yaml** â€” YAML parsing for `modes.yaml`, `wm.yaml`, and template frontmatter\n    83â†’\n    84â†’## Data-driven design principles\n    85â†’\n    86â†’**No hardcoded mode names in logic.** Mode behavior is driven by fields in `modes.yaml`:\n    87â†’- `issue_handling: \"required\" | \"none\"` â€” whether mode entry requires a GitHub issue\n    88â†’- `stop_conditions: string[]` â€” which exit checks to run (`tasks_complete`, `committed`, `pushed`, `verification`, `tests_pass`, `feature_tests_added`). Empty array = can always exit.\n    89â†’\n    90â†’When adding new per-mode behavior, add a field to `modes.yaml` + `ModeConfigSchema`, never hardcode mode names in TypeScript.\n    91â†’\n    92â†’## Eval harness (`eval/`)\n    93â†’\n    94â†’Agentic eval suite using `@anthropic-ai/claude-agent-sdk`. The harness drives inner Claude agents through kata scenarios with real tool execution.\n    95â†’\n    96â†’### Key design decisions\n    97â†’\n    98â†’- **`settingSources: ['project']`** loads `.claude/settings.json` â€” hooks fire naturally in the SDK, no manual context injection needed. Never use `appendSystemPrompt` for hook context.\n    99â†’- **`permissionMode: 'bypassPermissions'`** â€” full agent autonomy, no tool approval prompts.\n   100â†’- **AskUserQuestion pause/resume** â€” a PreToolUse hook intercepts AskUserQuestion, stops the session (`continue: false`), outputs question + session_id. Resume with `--resume=<session_id> --answer=\"<choice>\"`.\n   101â†’- **Fixture per scenario** â€” `EvalScenario.fixture` field selects which `eval-fixtures/` dir to copy. Fresh projects get `git init` automatically.\n   102â†’- **`CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR` stripped** from inner agent env so it doesn't escape to the outer project.\n   103â†’\n   104â†’### Running evals\n   105â†’\n   106â†’```bash\n   107â†’npx tsx eval/run.ts --scenario=onboard --verbose       # Single scenario\n   108â†’npx tsx eval/run.ts --list                              # List scenarios\n   109â†’npx tsx eval/run.ts --scenario=onboard --project=<dir> --resume=<sid> --answer=\"Quick\"  # Resume paused\n   110â†’```\n   111â†’\n   112â†’### Eval mode\n   113â†’\n   114â†’`eval` is a project-level mode override (`.claude/workflows/modes.yaml`), not in the batteries templates. Enter with `kata enter eval` â€” creates per-scenario tasks with dependency chains.\n   115â†’\n   116â†’### Fixtures\n   117â†’\n   118â†’| Fixture | Path | Description |\n   119â†’|---------|------|-------------|\n   120â†’| `tanstack-start` | `eval-fixtures/tanstack-start/` | Fresh TanStack Start app, no kata config |\n   121â†’| `web-app` | `eval-fixtures/web-app/` | Pre-configured with kata hooks, wm.yaml, templates |\n   122â†’\n   123â†’## Project root resolution\n   124â†’\n   125â†’`findClaudeProjectDir()` walks up from cwd looking for `.claude/sessions/` or `.claude/workflows/`. It **stops at `.git` boundaries** to prevent escaping into a parent project (e.g., eval projects nested under this repo). If cwd has `.git` but no `.claude/`, it's a fresh project â€” the walk stops there.\n   126â†’"}]},"uuid":"b4fae00a-ca1d-4b3a-a8d1-3cb7ad761cfb","timestamp":"2026-02-21T14:59:43.413Z","sourceToolAssistantUUID":"5662bcda-7aea-4835-a4ec-e3498581ece7"}

{"parentUuid":"5059c45e-9bb0-4fad-ae64-31f1eafd3bab","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"progress","data":{"type":"hook_progress","hookEvent":"PostToolUse","hookName":"PostToolUse:Read","command":"callback"},"parentToolUseID":"toolu_01Wh4rgBGCfd3LV2sVPNvsfF","toolUseID":"toolu_01Wh4rgBGCfd3LV2sVPNvsfF","timestamp":"2026-02-21T14:59:13.614Z","uuid":"61682bce-a7a2-4557-814a-c7104a35f0bc"}
{"parentUuid":"305e2413-9d57-4819-ba94-a6b04155ce96","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01Wh4rgBGCfd3LV2sVPNvsfF","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’---
     2â†’id: research
     3â†’name: Research Mode
     4â†’description: Deep exploration with documented findings and agent-parallel search
     5â†’mode: research
     6â†’
     7â†’phases:
     8â†’  - id: p0
     9â†’    name: Initial Clarification
    10â†’    task_config:
    11â†’      title: "P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why"
    12â†’      labels: [phase, phase-0, clarify]
    13â†’    gate: false
    14â†’    steps:
    15â†’      - id: clarify-intent
    16â†’        title: "Clarify research intent"
    17â†’        instruction: |
    18â†’          Use AskUserQuestion IMMEDIATELY after mode activation to understand:
    19â†’          - What topic/area they want to explore
    20â†’          - Why they need this research (context)
    21â†’          - What they'll do with the findings
    22â†’
    23â†’          AskUserQuestion(questions=[
    24â†’            {
    25â†’              question: "What would you like to research or explore?",
    26â†’              header: "Topic",
    27â†’              options: [
    28â†’                {label: "Codebase patterns", description: "Find how something is implemented"},
    29â†’                {label: "External best practices", description: "Research industry approaches"},
    30â†’                {label: "Both codebase + external", description: "Comprehensive exploration"},
    31â†’                {label: "Discussion only", description: "Brainstorm or clarify ideas"}
    32â†’              ],
    33â†’              multiSelect: false
    34â†’            },
    35â†’            {
    36â†’              question: "What's the context for this research?",
    37â†’              header: "Context",
    38â†’              options: [
    39â†’                {label: "Planning a feature", description: "Research before writing a spec"},
    40â†’                {label: "Debugging", description: "Understanding existing behavior"},
    41â†’                {label: "Decision making", description: "Evaluating architectural options"},
    42â†’                {label: "Learning", description: "General understanding"}
    43â†’              ],
    44â†’              multiSelect: false
    45â†’            }
    46â†’          ])
    47â†’
    48â†’          Based on answers, determine which phases to include/skip.
    49â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    50â†’
    51â†’  - id: p1
    52â†’    name: Scope Definition
    53â†’    task_config:
    54â†’      title: "P1: Scope - define questions and success criteria"
    55â†’      labels: [phase, phase-1, scope]
    56â†’      depends_on: [p0]
    57â†’    gate: false
    58â†’    steps:
    59â†’      - id: define-questions
    60â†’        title: "Define specific research questions"
    61â†’        instruction: |
    62â†’          Write down the specific questions this research needs to answer:
    63â†’
    64â†’          1. Primary question: {what must be answered}
    65â†’          2. Secondary questions: {nice to have}
    66â†’          3. Success criteria: {what does a complete answer look like}
    67â†’
    68â†’          Also: check GitHub issues for related context:
    69â†’          ```bash
    70â†’          gh issue list --search "{topic}" --limit 5
    71â†’          ```
    72â†’
    73â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    74â†’
    75â†’      - id: set-boundaries
    76â†’        title: "Set research boundaries"
    77â†’        instruction: |
    78â†’          Define explicit boundaries to prevent scope creep:
    79â†’
    80â†’          **IN scope:**
    81â†’          - {what to explore}
    82â†’
    83â†’          **OUT of scope:**
    84â†’          - {what to skip even if interesting}
    85â†’
    86â†’          **Time limit:** Set a rough budget (e.g. "30 min codebase, 15 min external").
    87â†’          Research expands indefinitely without boundaries.
    88â†’
    89â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    90â†’
    91â†’  - id: p2
    92â†’    name: Codebase Research
    93â†’    optional: true
    94â†’    task_config:
    95â†’      title: "P2: Codebase - parallel agent exploration (optional)"
    96â†’      labels: [phase, phase-2, codebase, optional]
    97â†’      depends_on: [p1]
    98â†’    gate: false
    99â†’    steps:
   100â†’      - id: spawn-explore-parallel
   101â†’        title: "Spawn parallel Explore agents"
   102â†’        instruction: |
   103â†’          Run multiple agents in parallel for fast codebase coverage:
   104â†’
   105â†’          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
   106â†’            Find implementations of {topic} in the codebase.
   107â†’            Search with Glob and Grep for relevant files.
   108â†’            Read the most relevant files IN FULL.
   109â†’            Document: file paths, function names, key patterns.
   110â†’            Be thorough â€” don't just skim.
   111â†’          ", run_in_background=true)
   112â†’
   113â†’          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
   114â†’            Search .claude/rules/ and docs/ for patterns related to {topic}.
   115â†’            List: constraints, best practices, architectural decisions.
   116â†’            Read relevant rule files IN FULL.
   117â†’          ", run_in_background=true)
   118â†’
   119â†’          # Store task IDs for aggregation step below
   120â†’
   121â†’      - id: aggregate-codebase-findings
   122â†’        title: "Aggregate codebase findings"
   123â†’        instruction: |
   124â†’          Wait for all agents:
   125â†’          TaskOutput(task_id=..., block=true)  # each agent
   126â†’
   127â†’          Compile into structured findings:
   128â†’          ## Codebase Findings
   129â†’          - Pattern 1: {description} (source: file:line)
   130â†’          - Pattern 2: {description} (source: file:line)
   131â†’          - Existing constraint: {rule or decision}
   132â†’
   133â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   134â†’
   135â†’  - id: p3
   136â†’    name: External Research
   137â†’    optional: true
   138â†’    task_config:
   139â†’      title: "P3: External - documentation and best practices (optional)"
   140â†’      labels: [phase, phase-3, external, optional]
   141â†’      depends_on: [p2]
   142â†’    gate: false
   143â†’    steps:
   144â†’      - id: web-research
   145â†’        title: "Web research and documentation review"
   146â†’        instruction: |
   147â†’          Search for external context:
   148â†’          WebSearch(query="{topic} best practices {year}")
   149â†’          WebSearch(query="{topic} vs {alternative} comparison")
   150â†’
   151â†’          Fetch relevant documentation:
   152â†’          WebFetch(url="{doc-url}", prompt="Extract key patterns and recommendations")
   153â†’
   154â†’          Document findings with sources (URLs).
   155â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   156â†’
   157â†’  - id: p4
   158â†’    name: Synthesis
   159â†’    task_config:
   160â†’      title: "P4: Synthesize - compile findings, identify recommendations"
   161â†’      labels: [phase, phase-4, synthesize]
   162â†’      depends_on: [p3]
   163â†’    gate: false
   164â†’    steps:
   165â†’      - id: synthesize-findings
   166â†’        title: "Synthesize all findings"
   167â†’        instruction: |
   168â†’          Create structured summary:
   169â†’
   170â†’          ## Research Summary: {topic}
   171â†’
   172â†’          ### Questions Answered
   173â†’          - Q: {question}
   174â†’            A: {answer} (source: file:line or URL)
   175â†’
   176â†’          ### Key Findings
   177â†’          - {finding} (source)
   178â†’          - {finding} (source)
   179â†’
   180â†’          ### Recommendations
   181â†’          | Option | Pros | Cons | Fit |
   182â†’          |--------|------|------|-----|
   183â†’          | A      | ...  | ...  | High|
   184â†’          | B      | ...  | ...  | Med |
   185â†’
   186â†’          ### Open Questions
   187â†’          - {what's still unclear}
   188â†’
   189â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   190â†’
   191â†’      - id: create-research-doc
   192â†’        title: "Write research findings document"
   193â†’        instruction: |
   194â†’          Read `research_path` from `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml` (default: `planning/research`).
   195â†’          Create persistent findings doc at:
   196â†’          `{research_path}/{YYYY-MM-DD}-{slug}.md`
   197â†’
   198â†’          Structure:
   199â†’          ```markdown
   200â†’          ---
   201â†’          date: {YYYY-MM-DD}
   202â†’          topic: {topic}
   203â†’          status: complete
   204â†’          github_issue: {N or null}
   205â†’          ---
   206â†’
   207â†’          # Research: {topic}
   208â†’
   209â†’          ## Context
   210â†’          Why this research was done.
   211â†’
   212â†’          ## Questions Explored
   213â†’          - {question 1}
   214â†’
   215â†’          ## Findings
   216â†’          ### Codebase
   217â†’          - {finding} (file:line)
   218â†’
   219â†’          ### External
   220â†’          - {finding} (URL)
   221â†’
   222â†’          ## Recommendations
   223â†’          {ranked options}
   224â†’
   225â†’          ## Open Questions
   226â†’          - {unclear things}
   227â†’
   228â†’          ## Next Steps
   229â†’          {none / create spec / more research}
   230â†’          ```
   231â†’
   232â†’          Then commit:
   233â†’          ```bash
   234â†’          git add {research_path}/
   235â†’          git commit -m "docs(research): {topic}"
   236â†’          git push
   237â†’          ```
   238â†’
   239â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   240â†’
   241â†’  - id: p5
   242â†’    name: Present
   243â†’    task_config:
   244â†’      title: "P5: Present - share findings, determine next steps"
   245â†’      labels: [phase, phase-5, present]
   246â†’      depends_on: [p4]
   247â†’    gate: false
   248â†’    steps:
   249â†’      - id: present-and-decide
   250â†’        title: "Present findings and decide next step"
   251â†’        instruction: |
   252â†’          Present the research summary to the user.
   253â†’
   254â†’          Then ask:
   255â†’          AskUserQuestion(questions=[{
   256â†’            question: "Research complete. What next?",
   257â†’            header: "Next Step",
   258â†’            options: [
   259â†’              {label: "Plan the feature", description: "Switch to planning mode to write a spec"},
   260â†’              {label: "More research needed", description: "Continue exploring specific questions"},
   261â†’              {label: "Done", description: "Research complete, no immediate action"}
   262â†’            ],
   263â†’            multiSelect: false
   264â†’          }])
   265â†’
   266â†’          Follow through on their choice.
   267â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   268â†’
   269â†’global_conditions:
   270â†’  - changes_committed
   271â†’  - changes_pushed
   272â†’
   273â†’workflow_id_format: "RS-{session_last_4}-{MMDD}"
   274â†’---
   275â†’
   276â†’# Research Mode
   277â†’
   278â†’Deep exploration with parallel agent search and documented findings.
   279â†’
   280â†’## Phase Flow
   281â†’
   282â†’```
   283â†’P0: Clarify (required)     â†’ understand what to research
   284â†’P1: Scope (required)       â†’ define questions + success criteria
   285â†’P2: Codebase (optional)    â†’ parallel Explore agents
   286â†’P3: External (optional)    â†’ web search + documentation
   287â†’P4: Synthesize (required)  â†’ compile findings + write research doc
   288â†’P5: Present (required)     â†’ share results + decide next step
   289â†’```
   290â†’
   291â†’## Output
   292â†’
   293â†’- Research doc: `{research_path}/{date}-{slug}.md` (configurable in wm.yaml)
   294â†’- Structured findings with sources
   295â†’- Ranked recommendations
   296â†’- Next steps (none, planning, more research)
   297â†’"}]},"uuid":"7e8de25d-b9c2-47a3-b486-961213b0878e","timestamp":"2026-02-21T14:59:13.613Z","sourceToolAssistantUUID":"305e2413-9d57-4819-ba94-a6b04155ce96"}

{"parentUuid":"f8ac4fd9-3951-47af-918c-e2a15fe079cc","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_018QZyScogpyfATwZ7XeprFC","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’---
     2â†’id: implementation
     3â†’name: "Feature Implementation"
     4â†’description: "Execute approved spec â€” claim branch, implement, review, close with PR"
     5â†’mode: implementation
     6â†’phases:
     7â†’  - id: p0
     8â†’    name: Baseline
     9â†’    task_config:
    10â†’      title: "P0: Baseline - verify environment, read spec, confirm approach"
    11â†’      labels: [orchestration, baseline]
    12â†’    steps:
    13â†’      - id: read-spec
    14â†’        title: "Read and understand the spec"
    15â†’        instruction: |
    16â†’          Find and read the approved spec:
    17â†’          ```bash
    18â†’          ls planning/specs/ | grep "{issue-number or keyword}"
    19â†’          ```
    20â†’
    21â†’          Read the spec IN FULL. Understand:
    22â†’          - All behaviors (B1, B2, ...) and their acceptance criteria
    23â†’          - All implementation phases and their tasks
    24â†’          - Non-goals (what NOT to do)
    25â†’
    26â†’          If no spec exists, ask user for the spec file location.
    27â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    28â†’
    29â†’      - id: verify-environment
    30â†’        title: "Verify dev environment is working"
    31â†’        instruction: |
    32â†’          Run sanity checks before making any changes:
    33â†’          ```bash
    34â†’          # Check types pass on clean tree
    35â†’          # (use your project's typecheck command)
    36â†’          git status  # Should be clean
    37â†’          git log --oneline -3  # Confirm you're on the right branch
    38â†’          ```
    39â†’
    40â†’          Document: current branch, any pre-existing issues.
    41â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    42â†’
    43â†’  - id: p1
    44â†’    name: Claim
    45â†’    task_config:
    46â†’      title: "P1: Claim - create branch, link GitHub issue"
    47â†’      labels: [orchestration, claim]
    48â†’      depends_on: [p0]
    49â†’    steps:
    50â†’      - id: create-branch
    51â†’        title: "Create feature branch"
    52â†’        instruction: |
    53â†’          Create a branch for this work:
    54â†’          ```bash
    55â†’          git checkout -b feature/{issue-number}-{slug}
    56â†’          git push -u origin feature/{issue-number}-{slug}
    57â†’          ```
    58â†’
    59â†’          Or if already on a feature branch, confirm it's up to date:
    60â†’          ```bash
    61â†’          git fetch origin
    62â†’          git status
    63â†’          ```
    64â†’
    65â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    66â†’
    67â†’      - id: claim-github-issue
    68â†’        title: "Claim GitHub issue"
    69â†’        instruction: |
    70â†’          If GitHub issue exists, claim it:
    71â†’          ```bash
    72â†’          gh issue edit {N} --remove-label "status:todo" --remove-label "approved" --add-label "status:in-progress"
    73â†’          gh issue comment {N} --body "Starting implementation on branch: feature/{issue-number}-{slug}"
    74â†’          ```
    75â†’
    76â†’          If no GitHub issue, skip this step.
    77â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    78â†’
    79â†’  - id: p2
    80â†’    name: Implement
    81â†’    container: true
    82â†’    subphase_pattern:
    83â†’      - id_suffix: impl
    84â†’        title_template: "IMPL - {task_summary}"
    85â†’        todo_template: "Implement {task_summary}"
    86â†’        active_form: "Implementing {phase_name}"
    87â†’        labels: [impl]
    88â†’      - id_suffix: verify
    89â†’        title_template: "VERIFY - {phase_name}"
    90â†’        todo_template: "Verify {phase_name} implementation"
    91â†’        active_form: "Verifying {phase_name}"
    92â†’        labels: [verify]
    93â†’        depends_on_previous: true
    94â†’
    95â†’  - id: p3
    96â†’    name: Close
    97â†’    task_config:
    98â†’      title: "P3: Close - final checks, commit, PR, close issue"
    99â†’      labels: [orchestration, close]
   100â†’      depends_on: [p2]
   101â†’    steps:
   102â†’      - id: final-checks
   103â†’        title: "Run final checks"
   104â†’        instruction: |
   105â†’          Before closing:
   106â†’          ```bash
   107â†’          git status          # All changes staged?
   108â†’          git diff --staged   # Review what's being committed
   109â†’          ```
   110â†’
   111â†’          Run your project's test and typecheck commands.
   112â†’          Fix any remaining issues.
   113â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   114â†’
   115â†’      - id: commit-and-push
   116â†’        title: "Commit and push all changes"
   117â†’        instruction: |
   118â†’          Commit all implementation work:
   119â†’          ```bash
   120â†’          git add {changed files}
   121â†’          git commit -m "feat({scope}): {description}
   122â†’
   123â†’          Implements #{github-issue-number}"
   124â†’          git push
   125â†’          ```
   126â†’
   127â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   128â†’
   129â†’      - id: create-pr
   130â†’        title: "Create pull request"
   131â†’        instruction: |
   132â†’          Create a PR:
   133â†’          ```bash
   134â†’          gh pr create \
   135â†’            --title "feat: {feature title} (#N)" \
   136â†’            --body "## Summary
   137â†’          - {bullet 1}
   138â†’          - {bullet 2}
   139â†’
   140â†’          ## Changes
   141â†’          - {file/component}: {what changed}
   142â†’
   143â†’          Closes #{N}" \
   144â†’            --base main
   145â†’          ```
   146â†’
   147â†’          Note the PR URL. Move issue to in-review:
   148â†’          ```bash
   149â†’          gh issue edit {N} --remove-label "status:in-progress" --add-label "status:in-review"
   150â†’          ```
   151â†’
   152â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   153â†’
   154â†’      - id: close-issue
   155â†’        title: "Update GitHub issue"
   156â†’        instruction: |
   157â†’          If GitHub issue exists:
   158â†’          ```bash
   159â†’          gh issue comment {N} --body "Implementation complete. PR: {pr-url}"
   160â†’          ```
   161â†’
   162â†’          The issue will auto-close when PR is merged ("Closes #N" in PR body).
   163â†’          On merge, add status:done:
   164â†’          ```bash
   165â†’          gh issue edit {N} --remove-label "status:in-review" --add-label "status:done"
   166â†’          ```

{"parentUuid":"5662bcda-7aea-4835-a4ec-e3498581ece7","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01T84jJdYGddS3dh6EWWevAV","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Commands
     6â†’
     7â†’```bash
     8â†’npm run build        # Compile TypeScript â†’ dist/ (required before running tests)
     9â†’npm run dev          # Watch mode build
    10â†’npm run typecheck    # Type-check without emitting
    11â†’npm test             # Run tests (requires a prior build)
    12â†’```
    13â†’
    14â†’To run tests after code changes: `npm run build && npm test`.
    15â†’
    16â†’Test files live alongside source with `.test.ts` suffixes (e.g. `src/commands/can-exit.test.ts`). Node's built-in test runner (`node --test`) executes them from `dist/testing/index.js`.
    17â†’
    18â†’The `kata` shell script at the repo root is the CLI entry point. It runs `dist/index.js` via Node when built, or falls back to Bun running `src/index.ts` directly for no-build development.
    19â†’
    20â†’## Architecture
    21â†’
    22â†’**kata-wm** is a TypeScript CLI published as an npm package (`kata-wm`). It wraps Claude Code projects with structured session modes, phase task enforcement, and stop hooks.
    23â†’
    24â†’### Source layout (`src/`)
    25â†’
    26â†’| Directory | Purpose |
    27â†’|-----------|---------|
    28â†’| `index.ts` | CLI dispatcher â€” maps `kata <command>` to handler functions; also re-exports the programmatic API |
    29â†’| `commands/` | One file per CLI command (`enter.ts`, `exit.ts`, `hook.ts`, `setup.ts`, etc.) |
    30â†’| `commands/enter/` | Sub-modules for the `enter` command: `task-factory.ts` (native task creation), `guidance.ts`, `template.ts`, `spec.ts` |
    31â†’| `session/lookup.ts` | Project root discovery, session ID resolution, template path resolution |
    32â†’| `state/` | Zod schema (`schema.ts`), reader/writer for `SessionState` JSON |
    33â†’| `config/` | `wm-config.ts` loads `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml`; `cache.ts` loads and merges `modes.yaml` |
    34â†’| `validation/` | Phase/template validation |
    35â†’| `yaml/` | YAML frontmatter parser for template files |
    36â†’| `utils/` | Workflow ID generation, session cleanup, timestamps |
    37â†’| `testing/` | Test utilities exported as `kata-wm/testing` â€” mock sessions, hook runners, assertions, pre-built scenarios |
    38â†’
    39â†’### Build outputs
    40â†’
    41â†’tsup produces ESM-only output with two entry points:
    42â†’- `dist/index.js` â€” main CLI and programmatic API
    43â†’- `dist/testing/index.js` â€” test utilities (also used by `node --test` as the test runner)
    44â†’
    45â†’### Runtime data layout
    46â†’
    47â†’| Path | Contents |
    48â†’|------|---------|
    49â†’| `.claude/sessions/{sessionId}/state.json` | Per-session `SessionState` (mode, phase, workflow ID, history) |
    50â†’| `~/.claude/tasks/{sessionId}/` | Native task files read by `can-exit` and `hook stop-conditions` |
    51â†’| `.claude/workflows/wm.yaml` | Project config (`WmConfig`) |
    52â†’| `.claude/workflows/modes.yaml` | Project-level mode overrides (merged over `modes.yaml` at package root) |
    53â†’| `.claude/workflows/templates/` | Mode templates â€” `onboard.md` seeded by `kata setup`; full set seeded by `kata batteries` |
    54â†’| `planning/spec-templates/` | Spec document stubs â€” feature, bug, epic (copied from `batteries/spec-templates/` during `kata batteries`) |
    55â†’
    56â†’### Hook architecture
    57â†’
    58â†’Hooks are registered in `.claude/settings.json` and call `kata hook <name>`. Each hook reads Claude Code's stdin JSON, extracts `session_id`, and outputs a JSON decision. The session ID from hook stdin **must** be forwarded as `--session=ID` to any subcommand â€” there is no automatic session detection at runtime.
    59â†’
    60â†’| Hook event | Command | Role |
    61â†’|------------|---------|------|
    62â†’| `SessionStart` | `kata hook session-start` | Init session registry, inject mode context |
    63â†’| `UserPromptSubmit` | `kata hook user-prompt` | Detect mode intent, suggest entering a mode |
    64â†’| `Stop` | `kata hook stop-conditions` | Block exit while native tasks are incomplete |
    65â†’| `PreToolUse` (optional) | `kata hook mode-gate` / `task-deps` / `task-evidence` | Strict-mode enforcement |
    66â†’
    67â†’### Mode and template system
    68â†’
    69â†’Built-in modes are defined in `modes.yaml` (package root). Each mode references a template filename with YAML frontmatter defining phases, task titles, and dependency chains.
    70â†’
    71â†’**Template sources:**
    72â†’- `templates/` â€” system templates only: `onboard.md` and `SESSION-TEMPLATE.template.md`
    73â†’- `batteries/templates/` â€” canonical mode templates (implementation, planning, task, bugfix, etc.)
    74â†’
    75â†’After setup, the project owns copies under `.claude/workflows/templates/`. The package files are seeds only, not used at runtime. To update project templates with newer versions, run `kata batteries --update`.
    76â†’
    77â†’Project modes in `.claude/workflows/modes.yaml` are merged over the built-in set with project definitions taking precedence.
    78â†’
    79â†’### Key dependencies
    80â†’
    81â†’- **zod** â€” schema validation for `SessionState`, `ModeConfig`, and config files
    82â†’- **js-yaml** â€” YAML parsing for `modes.yaml`, `wm.yaml`, and template frontmatter
    83â†’
    84â†’## Data-driven design principles
    85â†’
    86â†’**No hardcoded mode names in logic.** Mode behavior is driven by fields in `modes.yaml`:
    87â†’- `issue_handling: "required" | "none"` â€” whether mode entry requires a GitHub issue
    88â†’- `stop_conditions: string[]` â€” which exit checks to run (`tasks_complete`, `committed`, `pushed`, `verification`, `tests_pass`, `feature_tests_added`). Empty array = can always exit.
    89â†’
    90â†’When adding new per-mode behavior, add a field to `modes.yaml` + `ModeConfigSchema`, never hardcode mode names in TypeScript.
    91â†’
    92â†’## Eval harness (`eval/`)
    93â†’
    94â†’Agentic eval suite using `@anthropic-ai/claude-agent-sdk`. The harness drives inner Claude agents through kata scenarios with real tool execution.
    95â†’
    96â†’### Key design decisions
    97â†’
    98â†’- **`settingSources: ['project']`** loads `.claude/settings.json` â€” hooks fire naturally in the SDK, no manual context injection needed. Never use `appendSystemPrompt` for hook context.
    99â†’- **`permissionMode: 'bypassPermissions'`** â€” full agent autonomy, no tool approval prompts.
   100â†’- **AskUserQuestion pause/resume** â€” a PreToolUse hook intercepts AskUserQuestion, stops the session (`continue: false`), outputs question + session_id. Resume with `--resume=<session_id> --answer="<choice>"`.
   101â†’- **Fixture per scenario** â€” `EvalScenario.fixture` field selects which `eval-fixtures/` dir to copy. Fresh projects get `git init` automatically.
   102â†’- **`CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR` stripped** from inner agent env so it doesn't escape to the outer project.
   103â†’
   104â†’### Running evals
   105â†’
   106â†’```bash
   107â†’npx tsx eval/run.ts --scenario=onboard --verbose       # Single scenario
   108â†’npx tsx eval/run.ts --list                              # List scenarios
   109â†’npx tsx eval/run.ts --scenario=onboard --project=<dir> --resume=<sid> --answer="Quick"  # Resume paused
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Eval mode
   113â†’
   114â†’`eval` is a project-level mode override (`.claude/workflows/modes.yaml`), not in the batteries templates. Enter with `kata enter eval` â€” creates per-scenario tasks with dependency chains.
   115â†’
   116â†’### Fixtures
   117â†’
   118â†’| Fixture | Path | Description |
   119â†’|---------|------|-------------|
   120â†’| `tanstack-start` | `eval-fixtures/tanstack-start/` | Fresh TanStack Start app, no kata config |
   121â†’| `web-app` | `eval-fixtures/web-app/` | Pre-configured with kata hooks, wm.yaml, templates |
   122â†’
   123â†’## Project root resolution
   124â†’
   125â†’`findClaudeProjectDir()` walks up from cwd looking for `.claude/sessions/` or `.claude/workflows/`. It **stops at `.git` boundaries** to prevent escaping into a parent project (e.g., eval projects nested under this repo). If cwd has `.git` but no `.claude/`, it's a fresh project â€” the walk stops there.
   126â†’"}]},"uuid":"b4fae00a-ca1d-4b3a-a8d1-3cb7ad761cfb","timestamp":"2026-02-21T14:59:43.413Z","sourceToolAssistantUUID":"5662bcda-7aea-4835-a4ec-e3498581ece7"}

1. Search for all navigation components and patterns:
   - Grep for `<Link`, `useNavigate`, `useRouter`, `redirect` across the codebase

2. Search for data loading patterns:

3. Search for route parameter usage:
   - Grep for `useParams`, `$`, route params patterns
   - Grep for `searchParams`, `useSearch`
4. Read the TanStack Router/Start config files:
   - Look for `tsr.config.ts`, `app.config.ts`, `vite.config.ts`, `tanstack.config.ts`
   - Read package.json for TanStack dependencies and versions
5. Read any middleware or auth-related route guards

Read all relevant files IN FULL. Document: how navigation happens, how data is loaded per route, how parameters work.

{"parentUuid":"305e2413-9d57-4819-ba94-a6b04155ce96","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01Wh4rgBGCfd3LV2sVPNvsfF","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’---
     2â†’id: research
     3â†’name: Research Mode
     4â†’description: Deep exploration with documented findings and agent-parallel search
     5â†’mode: research
     6â†’
     7â†’phases:
     8â†’  - id: p0
     9â†’    name: Initial Clarification
    10â†’    task_config:
    11â†’      title: "P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why"
    12â†’      labels: [phase, phase-0, clarify]
    13â†’    gate: false
    14â†’    steps:
    15â†’      - id: clarify-intent
    16â†’        title: "Clarify research intent"
    17â†’        instruction: |
    18â†’          Use AskUserQuestion IMMEDIATELY after mode activation to understand:
    19â†’          - What topic/area they want to explore
    20â†’          - Why they need this research (context)
    21â†’          - What they'll do with the findings
    22â†’
    23â†’          AskUserQuestion(questions=[
    24â†’            {
    25â†’              question: "What would you like to research or explore?",
    26â†’              header: "Topic",
    27â†’              options: [
    28â†’                {label: "Codebase patterns", description: "Find how something is implemented"},
    29â†’                {label: "External best practices", description: "Research industry approaches"},
    30â†’                {label: "Both codebase + external", description: "Comprehensive exploration"},
    31â†’                {label: "Discussion only", description: "Brainstorm or clarify ideas"}
    32â†’              ],
    33â†’              multiSelect: false
    34â†’            },
    35â†’            {
    36â†’              question: "What's the context for this research?",
    37â†’              header: "Context",
    38â†’              options: [
    39â†’                {label: "Planning a feature", description: "Research before writing a spec"},
    40â†’                {label: "Debugging", description: "Understanding existing behavior"},
    41â†’                {label: "Decision making", description: "Evaluating architectural options"},
    42â†’                {label: "Learning", description: "General understanding"}
    43â†’              ],
    44â†’              multiSelect: false
    45â†’            }
    46â†’          ])
    47â†’
    48â†’          Based on answers, determine which phases to include/skip.
    49â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    50â†’
    51â†’  - id: p1
    52â†’    name: Scope Definition
    53â†’    task_config:
    54â†’      title: "P1: Scope - define questions and success criteria"
    55â†’      labels: [phase, phase-1, scope]
    56â†’      depends_on: [p0]
    57â†’    gate: false
    58â†’    steps:
    59â†’      - id: define-questions
    60â†’        title: "Define specific research questions"
    61â†’        instruction: |
    62â†’          Write down the specific questions this research needs to answer:
    63â†’
    64â†’          1. Primary question: {what must be answered}
    65â†’          2. Secondary questions: {nice to have}
    66â†’          3. Success criteria: {what does a complete answer look like}
    67â†’
    68â†’          Also: check GitHub issues for related context:
    69â†’          ```bash
    70â†’          gh issue list --search "{topic}" --limit 5
    71â†’          ```
    72â†’
    73â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    74â†’
    75â†’      - id: set-boundaries
    76â†’        title: "Set research boundaries"
    77â†’        instruction: |
    78â†’          Define explicit boundaries to prevent scope creep:
    79â†’
    80â†’          **IN scope:**
    81â†’          - {what to explore}
    82â†’
    83â†’          **OUT of scope:**
    84â†’          - {what to skip even if interesting}
    85â†’
    86â†’          **Time limit:** Set a rough budget (e.g. "30 min codebase, 15 min external").
    87â†’          Research expands indefinitely without boundaries.
    88â†’
    89â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    90â†’
    91â†’  - id: p2
    92â†’    name: Codebase Research
    93â†’    optional: true
    94â†’    task_config:
    95â†’      title: "P2: Codebase - parallel agent exploration (optional)"
    96â†’      labels: [phase, phase-2, codebase, optional]
    97â†’      depends_on: [p1]
    98â†’    gate: false
    99â†’    steps:
   100â†’      - id: spawn-explore-parallel
   101â†’        title: "Spawn parallel Explore agents"
   102â†’        instruction: |
   103â†’          Run multiple agents in parallel for fast codebase coverage:
   104â†’
   105â†’          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
   106â†’            Find implementations of {topic} in the codebase.
   107â†’            Search with Glob and Grep for relevant files.
   108â†’            Read the most relevant files IN FULL.
   109â†’            Document: file paths, function names, key patterns.
   110â†’            Be thorough â€” don't just skim.
   111â†’          ", run_in_background=true)
   112â†’
   113â†’          Task(subagent_type="Explore", prompt="
   114â†’            Search .claude/rules/ and docs/ for patterns related to {topic}.
   115â†’            List: constraints, best practices, architectural decisions.
   116â†’            Read relevant rule files IN FULL.
   117â†’          ", run_in_background=true)
   118â†’
   119â†’          # Store task IDs for aggregation step below
   120â†’
   121â†’      - id: aggregate-codebase-findings
   122â†’        title: "Aggregate codebase findings"
   123â†’        instruction: |
   124â†’          Wait for all agents:
   125â†’          TaskOutput(task_id=..., block=true)  # each agent
   126â†’
   127â†’          Compile into structured findings:
   128â†’          ## Codebase Findings
   129â†’          - Pattern 1: {description} (source: file:line)
   130â†’          - Pattern 2: {description} (source: file:line)
   131â†’          - Existing constraint: {rule or decision}
   132â†’
   133â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   134â†’
   135â†’  - id: p3
   136â†’    name: External Research
   137â†’    optional: true
   138â†’    task_config:
   139â†’      title: "P3: External - documentation and best practices (optional)"
   140â†’      labels: [phase, phase-3, external, optional]
   141â†’      depends_on: [p2]
   142â†’    gate: false
   143â†’    steps:
   144â†’      - id: web-research
   145â†’        title: "Web research and documentation review"
   146â†’        instruction: |
   147â†’          Search for external context:
   148â†’          WebSearch(query="{topic} best practices {year}")
   149â†’          WebSearch(query="{topic} vs {alternative} comparison")
   150â†’
   151â†’          Fetch relevant documentation:
   152â†’          WebFetch(url="{doc-url}", prompt="Extract key patterns and recommendations")
   153â†’
   154â†’          Document findings with sources (URLs).
   155â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   156â†’
   157â†’  - id: p4
   158â†’    name: Synthesis
   159â†’    task_config:
   160â†’      title: "P4: Synthesize - compile findings, identify recommendations"
   161â†’      labels: [phase, phase-4, synthesize]
   162â†’      depends_on: [p3]
   163â†’    gate: false
   164â†’    steps:
   165â†’      - id: synthesize-findings
   166â†’        title: "Synthesize all findings"
   167â†’        instruction: |
   168â†’          Create structured summary:
   169â†’
   170â†’          ## Research Summary: {topic}
   171â†’
   172â†’          ### Questions Answered
   173â†’          - Q: {question}

{"parentUuid":"f8ac4fd9-3951-47af-918c-e2a15fe079cc","isSidechain":true,"userType":"external","cwd":"/data/projects/kata-wm/eval-projects/tanstack-start","sessionId":"6e1acf85-c15c-4c3d-b1e6-3225e3bd1c5f","version":"2.1.50","gitBranch":"main","agentId":"a25bed19bda1f85c1","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_018QZyScogpyfATwZ7XeprFC","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’---
     2â†’id: implementation
     3â†’name: "Feature Implementation"
     4â†’description: "Execute approved spec â€” claim branch, implement, review, close with PR"
     5â†’mode: implementation
     6â†’phases:
     7â†’  - id: p0
     8â†’    name: Baseline
     9â†’    task_config:
    10â†’      title: "P0: Baseline - verify environment, read spec, confirm approach"

    12â†’    steps:

    15â†’        instruction: |

    20â†’

    28â†’
    29â†’      - id: verify-environment
    30â†’        title: "Verify dev environment is working"
    31â†’        instruction: |
    32â†’          Run sanity checks before making any changes:
    33â†’          ```bash
    34â†’          # Check types pass on clean tree
    35â†’          # (use your project's typecheck command)
    36â†’          git status  # Should be clean
    37â†’          git log --oneline -3  # Confirm you're on the right branch
    38â†’          ```
    39â†’
    40â†’          Document: current branch, any pre-existing issues.
    41â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
    42â†’
    43â†’  - id: p1
    44â†’    name: Claim
    45â†’    task_config:

    49â†’    steps:
    50â†’      - id: create-branch
    51â†’        title: "Create feature branch"
    52â†’        instruction: |
    53â†’          Create a branch for this work:
    54â†’          ```bash
    55â†’          git checkout -b feature/{issue-number}-{slug}
    56â†’          git push -u origin feature/{issue-number}-{slug}
    57â†’          ```
    58â†’
    59â†’          Or if already on a feature branch, confirm it's up to date:

    61â†’          git fetch origin
    62â†’          git status
    63â†’          ```
    64â†’
    65â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

    67â†’      - id: claim-github-issue
    68â†’        title: "Claim GitHub issue"
    69â†’        instruction: |

   109â†’          ```
   110â†’
   111â†’          Run your project's test and typecheck commands.
   112â†’          Fix any remaining issues.
   113â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite
   114â†’
   115â†’      - id: commit-and-push
   116â†’        title: "Commit and push all changes"
   117â†’        instruction: |
   118â†’          Commit all implementation work:
   119â†’          ```bash

   121â†’          git commit -m "feat({scope}): {description}
   122â†’

   125â†’          ```

   127â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

   129â†’      - id: create-pr
   130â†’        title: "Create pull request"
   131â†’        instruction: |
   132â†’          Create a PR:

   135â†’            --title "feat: {feature title} (#N)" \
   136â†’            --body "## Summary
   137â†’          - {bullet 1}
   138â†’          - {bullet 2}

   142â†’

   144â†’            --base main
   145â†’          ```
   146â†’
   147â†’          Note the PR URL. Move issue to in-review:
   148â†’          ```bash

   151â†’
   152â†’          Then: Mark this task completed via TodoWrite

   161â†’
   162â†’          The issue will auto-close when PR is merged ("Closes #N" in PR body).
   163â†’          On merge, add status:done:

   172â†’---
   173â†’
   174â†’# Implementation Mode
   175â†’
   176â†’You are in **implementation** mode. Execute the approved spec phase by phase.
   177â†’
   178â†’## Your Role
   179â†’
   180â†’- Read and understand the spec before writing any code
   181â†’- Implement each spec phase completely before moving to the next
   182â†’- Verify after each phase (typecheck, tests, git status)
   183â†’- Track progress via task updates (TodoWrite)
   184â†’
   185â†’## Phase Flow
   186â†’
   187â†’```
   188â†’P0: Baseline
   189â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ Read spec IN FULL
   190â†’    â””â”€â”€ Verify environment is clean
   191â†’
   192â†’P1: Claim
   193â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ Create feature branch
   194â†’    â””â”€â”€ Claim GitHub issue
   195â†’
   196â†’P2: Implement (per-spec-phase)
   197â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ IMPL: implement the phase tasks
   198â†’    â””â”€â”€ VERIFY: run checks, confirm behavior
   199â†’
   200â†’P3: Close
   201â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ Final typecheck + tests
   202â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ Commit + push
   203â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ Create PR
   204â†’    â””â”€â”€ Comment on GitHub issue
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’## Key Rules
   208â†’
   209â†’- **Read spec first** â€” understand ALL phases before writing code
   210â†’- **One phase at a time** â€” complete IMPL + VERIFY before moving on
   211â†’- **No scope creep** â€” spec's non-goals are off-limits
   212â†’- **Commit per phase** â€” smaller commits, easier review
   213â†’
   214â†’## Stop Conditions
   215â†’
   216â†’- All spec phases implemented and verified
   217â†’- Changes committed and pushed
   218â†’- PR created (or explicitly skipped)
